body.name: Apricorn Aegis Secure Key 3 NX 64GB 256-bit Encrypted FIPS 140-2 Level 3 Validated Secure USB 3.0 Flash Drive, ASK3-NX-64GB, black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 12 hrs 20 mins
body.description: The NeXt Generation of Secure Key: the Aegis Secure Key 3NX Our fourth generation of Secure Keys brings next generation security features, up to 25% cooler operating temperatures, and an even lower cost. Software-Free, 100% hardware-based 256-bit AES XTS encrypted, onboard keypad PIN authenticated, and ultra-fast USB 3.1 (3.0) data transfer speeds. All Data is encrypted on the fly and the device's PINs and Data remain encrypted while the drive is at rest. Completely cross-platform compatible and OS agnostic; thrives in Windows, Linux, Mac, Android, Chrome, embedded systems, and equipment possessing a powered USB port and storage file system. All internal componentry is protected from physical tampering with a layer of hardened epoxy, and locked-down firmware brings immunity to malware attacks such as BadUSB.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Software-Free, 256-Bit AES Hardware-Encrypted USB Innovations Trusted Worldwide for Protecting Sensitive Data. Headquartered in Poway, California, Apricorn provides a comprehensive range of secure USB storage innovations to prominent entities in the categories of finance, healthcare, education, and government throughout North America and the rest of the world. Apricorn products have become the trusted standard for myriad data security strategies worldwide. Founded in 1983, numerous award-winning products have been developed under the Apricorn brand as well as for a number of leading computer manufacturers on an OEM basis. *awards pictured above from 2019

Hardware-Encrypted USB 3.2 Flash keys Featuring a USB Type-A Connector The Aegis Secure Key 3NX is developed to economically and efficiently protect the data of the expanding global remote workforce by delivering all of the advanced security features found in the Aegis family of secure drives in 7 storage capacities ranging from 2GB to 128GB

Program Multiple Aegis Secure Keys Simultaneously with the Aegis Configurator Configure 1, 5, or 50 devices simultaneously, in a matter of seconds. Perfect for configuring devices as part of a high-volume corporate deployment. Quickly establish corporate security across all devices; Create Master Profiles, Customize Device Settings, and Preload Data onto Multiple Apricorn Drives with just a few clicks. Also manage master profiles, edit or add new ones, and search settings history by device from Admin dashboard access.

Built Tough, Inside and Out USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type A Connector Backward compatible with computers, hubs, and equipment possessing USB 1, 2, and 3 ports. Wear-Resistant Rubberized Buttons Polymer-coated and factory tested to defend against abrasion and obscure frequently pressed buttons. Positive-click press confirmation. Rugged Exterior Aluminum external case with hardened epoxy surrounding its internal circuitry to defend against physical tampering. Internal Lithium Battery Authentication occurs prior to connecting to host computer. Auto charges when inserted in a powered USB port.

3NX 3NXC 3Z 3.0 Connector Type USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A Dust / Water Resistance Rating IP68 IP68 IP68 IP68 Security Validation FIPS 140-2 lev. 3 FIPS 140-2 lev. 3 FIPS 140-2 lev. 3 FIPS 140-2 lev. 3 Capacities (GB) 2 | 4 | 8 | 16 | 32 | 64 | 128 4 | 8 | 16 | 32 | 64 | 128 16 | 32 | 64 | 128 16 | 30 | 60 | 120 | 240 | 480 | 1TB

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes secure easy
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Apricorn Aegis Secure Key 3NX, and I must say, it's been quite an impressive addition to my tech arsenal. This USB flash key offers a simple yet highly effective solution for keeping my sensitive data secure without the need for complicated software installations or setups.One of the standout features of the Aegis Secure Key 3NX is its robust 256-bit AES XTS encryption, which ensures that my data remains safe from prying eyes. It's a comforting thought knowing that even if I were to misplace this device, my information is still well-protected. Plus, the fact that it's FIPS 140-2 level 3 validated adds an extra layer of confidence in its security.The onboard keypad is a game-changer for me. It allows me to set a PIN to access the device, making it virtually impossible for anyone to access my files without the correct code. This feature simplifies security without compromising on effectiveness. I no longer have to worry about complex password management or software vulnerabilities.In terms of usability, it couldn't be easier. Just plug it in, enter your PIN, and you're good to go. It works seamlessly with my computer's USB 3.1 port, and there's no need for additional drivers or software. It's simple, straightforward, and gets the job done.Overall, the Apricorn Aegis Secure Key 3NX is a fantastic investment for anyone looking to secure their data without diving into the complexities of encryption software. It offers top-notch security, ease of use, and the added benefit of improved temperature management. It's a practical and reliable solution for keeping your important files safe, and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of a secure USB flash drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple to use and gives confidence on security of data
reviews.reviewText: Solidly made and just does what it says on the box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I had my doubts, but I needed a way to securely keep research data, in a simple, easy, uncomplicated manner. Guess what, this product did just that! Complicated tech drives me crazy; but this is uncomplicated. You pick a code, you plug it in, you follow the well written instructions on use, and this tool is Amazing!Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Simple to use. Great for when traveling or to simply keep in your safe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive and good Secure Key for storing critical information
reviews.reviewText: Needed this kind of device to store private keys and it works as advertised. Yes the keypad is small, but would think that is an issue with these type of devices. Never had an issue with access, but have only used a handful of times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My first one which I use for years was lost in transit to my accountant so I got a second one and of course I'm grateful that I had this because it provided the secure transmission of significant financial information.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple to use because of built in keypad
reviews.reviewText: Best feature is the unit is self contained. No need for a separate app to install on your computer. Simple to setup with well written instructions. This is the 2nd of these I've purchased and once you've set them up, they just work the way you think they should. Type in your pin and hit the unlock button, pretty simple. Times out on it's own to relock

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My third one...
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the older versions (USB 2.0) of the Apricorn Aegis Secure Key in 2017 and 2016, I store all my accounts, passwords, scanned documents and any important files on these USB sticks and so far they have proven to be utterly reliable. Both devices are still performing perfectly to included their batteries; nevertheless, given the importance of the data I store on them and the amount I use them I decided to purchased a third one as a backup, received 22 December 2020.The new version (USB 3.0), the NX, keys seem to be much more responsive than the old version; however, I do have a gripe about the new version. I dislike the LEDs for a few reasons. The old version used a Blue LED at the base of the stick which when it was plugged into a powered USB port would blink, brightly, to show it was charging, it was easy to see. The new one uses the Red LED which is very small making it difficult to see unless you are holding it in your hand. Obviously, this isn't a show stopper but it is a small inconvenience as one simply cannot look across the room to see if the unit is finished charging. Also, one normally associates a flashing Red light to mean a failure or error of some sort so I think they had it correct the first time with a Blue LED located on the device where it was clearly visible at all times.But, the bottom line will be reliability and only time will tell if this new and faster version is as dependable as the old.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a high capacity and very secure key. It satisfies those requirements. It was suggested to me by a colleague who has the same though with a smaller capacity

Der neueste, und günstigste aus der Securekey Reihe, da (noch) keine FIPS Zertifizierung. Für den Hausgebrauch aber allemal ausreichend, sicherheitstechnisch einwandfrei und den Konkurrenten im ähnlichen Preissegment (<100) in Qualität und Bedienbarkeit (zB keine Zusatzsoftware, solide Verarbeitung) überlegen.Technik, der man Vertrauen kann.Und für den ruhigeren Schlaf auch allemal das Geld wert ;)
Good quality and works as advertised. Easy to setup and use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: Ensure you make the password not too complicated
reviews.reviewText: Good product, took a little while to get it set up, (my fault) but it is what I was looking for and it makes me more secure.
